item.title: Roo add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Live to the point of tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Roo add a quote by H. L. Mencken
item.description: "All government, in its essence, is a conspiracy against the superior man: its one permanent object is to oppress him and cripple him. If it be aristocratic in organization, then it seeks to protect the man who is superior only in law against the man who is superior in fact; if it be democratic, then it seeks to protect the man who is inferior in every way against both. One of its primary functions is to regiment men by force, to make them as much alike as possible and as dependent upon one another as possible, to search out and combat originality among them. All it can see in an original idea is potential change, and hence an invasion of its prerogatives. The most dangerous man to any government is the man who is able to think things out for himself, without regard to the prevailing superstitions and taboos. Almost inevitably he comes to the conclusion that the government he lives under is dishonest, insane and intolerable, and so, if he is romantic, he tries to change it. And even if he is not romantic personally he is very apt to spread discontent among those who are." -- H. L. Mencken

item.title: Roo add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "We must respect the other fellow's religion, but only in the sense and to the extent that we respect his theory that his wife is beautiful and his children smart." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Roo add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The best teacher is not the one who knows most but the one who is most capable of reducing knowledge to that simple compound of the obvious and wonderful." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Roo add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "I am suspicious of all the things that the average people believes." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Roo add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "We are here and it is now. Further than that, all human knowledge is moonshine." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Roo add a quote by H. L. Mencken
item.description: "You can't do anything about the length of your life, but you can do something about its width and depth." -- H. L. Mencken
